title: How to Draw a Regular Hexagon with Only a Ruler

methods.name: Starting with the Center Point and Side length

steps.headline: Plot the center point of your hexagon and decide how long you want each side to be.
steps.description:
Label this length "S". {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/8\/80\/6gon_step-0.png","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/8\/80\/6gon_step-0.png","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":463,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":765.0666666666667,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons<\/a>
\n<\/p>


\n<\/p><\/div>"}

steps.headline: Plot 2 points on the vertical axis, S distance away from the center point.
steps.description:
These points can be "A" and "B". {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/c\/c0\/6gon_step-1.png","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/c\/c0\/6gon_step-1.png","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":341,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":563.0909090909091,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons<\/a>
\n<\/p>


\n<\/p><\/div>"}

steps.headline: Find the points halfway between the center point and A and the center point and B.
steps.description:
There, plot perpendicular guide lines. (You'll erase these later, so don't make them dark.) As a side note, the distance between the two guide lines is also equal to S.{"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/7\/76\/6gon_step-2.png","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/7\/76\/6gon_step-2.png","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":261,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":431.6376306620209,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons<\/a>
\n<\/p>


\n<\/p><\/div>"}

steps.headline: Draw 2 more guide lines that are equal to the length of 2S, or line AB, from each perpendicular line to the other so that they run through the center point.
steps.description:
The point where the guide lines intersect are the last 4 points of the hexagon. (These can be called CD and EF. ){"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/c\/c1\/6gon_step-3.png","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/c\/c1\/6gon_step-3.png","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":431,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":712.7950310559006,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons<\/a>
\n<\/p>


\n<\/p><\/div>"}

steps.headline: Connect the dots between the points and erase the guide lines.
steps.description:
Congrats! {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/9\/95\/6gon_step-4.png","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/9\/95\/6gon_step-4.png","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":431,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":712.7950310559006,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons<\/a>
\n<\/p>


\n<\/p><\/div>"}

methods.name: Starting from One Side and Using its Length

steps.headline: Draw and measure one line.
steps.description:
This will be the first side (and S length). {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/4\/47\/6gon2_step-1.png","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/4\/47\/6gon2_step-1.png","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":460,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":760,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons<\/a>
\n<\/p>


\n<\/p><\/div>"}

steps.headline: Draw 2 perpendicular guide lines at each end of the side extending in the direction you want your hexagon by at least 2S.
Draw 2 more guide lines, each the length of 2S, from the end points of your first side to the perpendicular guide line of the opposing point.
steps.description:
Draw a line between the points where they intersect. This is your second side. {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/2\/2a\/6gon2_step-3.png","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/2\/2a\/6gon2_step-3.png","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":446,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":737.3134328358209,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons<\/a>
\n<\/p>


\n<\/p><\/div>"}

steps.headline: Find the point halfway between these 2 sides.
steps.description:
Draw one last guide line parallel to the sides. {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/a\/a2\/6gon2_step-4a.png","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/a\/a2\/6gon2_step-4a.png","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":428,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":706.9767441860465,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons<\/a>
\n<\/p>


\n<\/p><\/div>"}

steps.headline: Mark where the center point between the horizontal guide lines is, on the vertical guide line.
steps.description:
Then mark the line S length away from it to the top and bottom. {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/5\/55\/6gon2_step-4.png","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/5\/55\/6gon2_step-4.png","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":428,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":706.9767441860465,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons<\/a>
\n<\/p>


\n<\/p><\/div>"}

steps.headline: Connect these points to the ends of the drawn sides.
steps.description:
Erase the guide lines. Congrats! {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/9\/95\/6gon_step-4.png","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/9\/95\/6gon_step-4.png","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":431,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":712.7950310559006,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons<\/a>
